author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
I've started the nodes again, that I shutdown for sync.
Prysm seems to have some issue, I get a lot of `RPC connection read error                err="websocket: close 1006 (abnormal closure): unexpected EOF"`errors on it.
Nimbus looked good, synced up a bit, but now hit a wall. 
Lodestar seems to crunch through the blocks quickest atm (might just be better peers)
https://ethstats.mainnetshadowfork1.ethdevops.io/
Nimbux, Prysm could you take a look at the unsynced nodes?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Prysm managed to pick itself up again and synced up. All nodes except for LH and nimbus already synced up.
LH seems to just be slow, Nimbus somehow reorged geth back to before TTD, now we need to import those old blocks again

author: tersec
content: oh, I have some idea what happened

author: potuz
content: cc <@311971895828283393> did you see those websocket errors?

author: potuz
content: seems like perhaps a data race on the connection.

author: raulj
content: We dont use any websockets in prysm and do not support connecting to a websocket rpc endpoint

author: raulj
content: We only use the http and ipc rpc clients
